com.poesys.cartridges.db.metafacades
Class AddInheritedPropertiesStrategy

java.lang.Object
  com.poesys.cartridges.db.metafacades.AddInheritedPropertiesStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAddPropertyStrategy
Direct Known Subclasses:
PersistentClassFacadeLogicImpl.AddInheritedAssociationAttributeProperties, PersistentClassFacadeLogicImpl.AddInheritedAssociationClassCollectionProperties, PersistentClassFacadeLogicImpl.AddInheritedAssociationObjectProperties, PersistentClassFacadeLogicImpl.AddInheritedRecursiveAssociationClassCollectionProperties, PersistentClassFacadeLogicImpl.AddInheritedToManyAssociationCollectionProperties, PersistentClassFacadeLogicImpl.AddInheritedToManyAssociationProperties
public abstract class AddInheritedPropertiesStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAddPropertyStrategy

An implementation of the IAddPropertyStrategy interface that provides a strategy for adding a set of inherited properties to a property list. The strategy walks the inheritence tree provided by a bridge to the AndroMDA getGeneralizations method run on the implementing class.

The implementation of this class must implement three abstract methods:

  • getCurrentFacade: returns the outer metafacade class that contains the implementation, which must be a PersistentClassFacade
  • addCurrentProperties: adds the appropriate set of properties extracted from the superclass facade to the list being built, setting a new source for each property.
  • getSource: return the source string, usually the name of the implementing nested class that extends this class
  • handleDuplicateProperties: handle any duplicate properties in the complete list

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Method Detail

addProperties

public void addProperties(java.util.List<Property> list)
Description copied from interface: IAddPropertyStrategy
Add an appropriate set of properties to a list of properties, adding the new properties at the end of the list. If the list is null, the method does nothing and returns.

Specified by:
addProperties in interface IAddPropertyStrategy
Parameters:
list - the required list of properties

handleDuplicateProperties

protected abstract void handleDuplicateProperties(java.util.List<Property> list)
Given a complete list of properties, handle any duplicate properties in a way appropriate to the specific list (rename properties, override properties, remove properties, and so on). This is not duplicate elimination per se but rather handling name polymorphism through overriding (eliminating the higher-level property).

Parameters:
list - the complete list of inherited properties

addSuperclassProperties

private void addSuperclassProperties(PersistentClassFacade superFacade,
                                     java.util.List<Property> list)
Add the superclass properties from the superclass facade to the list being built. This method calls itself recursively to perform the tree climb. It adds the properties from the current superclass as the last part of the method, so the properties are added in top-down, depth-first traversal.

Parameters:
superFacade - the metafacade representing the superclass
list - the properties to add

protected PersistentClassFacadeLogicImpl getSuperclassFacade(PersistentClassFacade facade)
Get the superclass metafacade if this is a subclass.

Parameters:
facade - the facade for which to get the superclass facade
Returns:
the superclass facade or null if there is no superclass

addCurrentProperties

protected abstract void addCurrentProperties(PersistentClassFacade superFacade,
                                             java.util.List<Property> list,
                                             java.lang.String source)
Add the current set of properties from the superclass facade to the list. The implementation must extract the relevant set of properties, set the appropriate source string in each property, then add it to the list.

Parameters:
superFacade - the metafacade for the superclass
list - the list of inherited properties being built
source - the source string that overwrites the property source
